last_episode_to_air.name: Deadlock in Parma
last_episode_to_air.overview: In the series finale, Jim Rockford drives off into a California sunset in his wounded Firebird, after being ensnared in a small-town council battle with big implications. While trout fishing in the mountains, the vacationing PI becomes the emergency proxy for a fellow angler, an environmentalist councilman, felled by appendicitis. But the seemingly-innocuous proposition for a Parma city park, attracts a trailer load of New Jersey mobsters who urge Rockford to keep his vote green, or sleep with the fishes. Meanwhile, this town council in the land of endless propositions, acts to force their temporary member Rockford to go fishing under the moonlight, but not in Parma.

name: The Rockford Files
overview: Cranky but likable L.A. PI Jim Rockford pulls no punches (but takes plenty of them). An ex-con sent to the slammer for a crime he didn't commit, Rockford takes on cases others don't want, aided by his tough old man, his lawyer girlfriend and some shady associates from his past.

seasons.name: Specials
seasons.overview: Private investigator Jim Rockford is hired by a beautiful young woman to solve the murder of her father, a homeless man found beneath a pier two months earlier. The killing was never solved by the Police.

tagline: This is Jim Rockford. At the tone leave your name and message, I'll get back to you.

episodes.name: The Kirkoff Case
episodes.overview: Rockford is hired by Larry Kirkoff to find the identity of his parents killer. There are a number of possible suspects including Travis Buckman and Tawnia Baker who were lovers of Mrs. and Mr. Kirkoff respectively. The police actually suspect Larry of the crime, but, lack of evidence prevents them from making a case against him. Rockford's investigation runs him afoul of some pretty bad men who want everyone to go on thinking Larry killed them.

episodes.name: The Dark and Bloody Ground
episodes.overview: Jim reluctantly agrees to work for Beth Davenport. His job is to help her prove her client, Ann Calhoun, is innocent of the crime she is accused of; murdering her husband Kevin Calhoun. Jim's investigation takes him to the town of Parker, Arizona, where the Calhouns are from. He digs up info someone doesn't want found out and is almost killed trying to return to L.A. Socialites Clyde Russell and Elizabeth Gorman, who were throwing a party the Calhouns attended, are also investigated. Jim's investigation is making someone nervous as another attempt is made on his life.

episodes.name: The Countess
episodes.overview: Jim is helping a Countess avoid a blackmailer but is then charged for the Blackmailer murder...

episodes.name: Exit Prentiss Carr
episodes.overview: Jim finds the murdered body of Prentiss Carr in his hotel room and after reporting the incident to the police learns it has been classified as suicide...

episodes.name: Tall Woman in Red Wagon
episodes.overview: Jim helps a journalist trace the whereabouts of her friend and has to adopt a series of covers in order to obtain the information, as well as contend with a mobsters goons and a Treasury Agent...

episodes.name: This Case Is Closed
episodes.overview: While investigating the fiance of Warren Jamison's daughter, Jim experiences some strange events which include kidnapping by the mob and the FBI who are anxious to get a statement - it all relates back to Jim recent trip to Newark...

episodes.name: The Big Ripoff
episodes.overview: Suspecting her ex-lover was killed by his wife, a woman hires Rockford to jet to Europe to compile evidence. After a fling with the widow, Rockford suspects Steve Nelson faked his death.

episodes.name: Find Me If You Can
episodes.overview: Rockford reluctantly takes a unique assignment: a beautiful mystery woman wants him to find her, to see if someone she fears could also track her down. With a check poised to bounce, the ex-con PI needs the retainer to balance his always-challenged checking account. When Rockford checks with a local police department, he worms out a chilling piece of data: she's been dating Denver Mafia capo-regime, hot-tempered Ralph Correll. But the more Barbara Kelbaker strings along Jim Rockford, the more he's charmed into helping the desperate 30 something.

episodes.name: In Pursuit of Carol Thorne
episodes.overview: Jim tails a woman just released from prison. She was involved in a robbery of a Marine Payroll. The mastermind of the crime and his henchman follow her as well. They search for the remaining robber who wound up with the loot.

episodes.name: The Dexter Crisis
episodes.overview: Rockford ends up in the Nevada desert (starting with the bright lights of Las Vegas) searching for a rich guy's mistress and her suitcase of precious "documents."

episodes.name: Caledonia - It's Worth a Fortune!
episodes.overview: When knowledge of a critically ill convict's hidden fortune comes to light, Rockford becomes involved in helping the con's wife find the treasure before his former partner arrives and demands his share.

episodes.name: Profit and Loss (1)
episodes.overview: Jim investigates a large corporation when one of its executives is kidnapped and the wife of another executive claims the company murdered her husband.

episodes.name: Profit and Loss (2)
episodes.overview: Rockford discovers the investment firm Fiscal Dynamics is a financial fraud and its president Leon Fielder will do anything to prevent him from destroying his company.

episodes.name: Aura Lee, Farewell
episodes.overview: Jim's old friend Sara Butler hires him to find out the real reason her employee Aura Lee Benton died. The police believe it was a drug overdose but Sara is convinced she was murdered.

episodes.name: Sleight of Hand
episodes.overview: Jim's girlfriend suddenly disappears with no clue as to how or why. Lt. Diel thinks Rockford is probably responsible for her disappearance and orders him to stay away from the case. But Jim can't stop until he finds out what happened.

episodes.name: Counter Gambit
episodes.overview: Two former cons hire Rockford to find an old girlfriend. They actually want her valuable pearl necklace and implicate him as the thief. With Angel's help, he'll get the pearls back and square himself with the police.

episodes.name: Claire
episodes.overview: Jim's old girlfriend, Claire Prescott, phones, and asks him to help give her protection from 2 hoods chasing her. He soon discovers there's a missing undercover cop, which puts him up against an arrogant Cpt. Highland, as well.

episodes.name: Say Goodbye to Jennifer
episodes.overview: John Micelli's an old war buddy of Jim', who's now a fashion photographer. He hires Jim to track down a beautiful fashion model, whom the authorities claim is dead; killed in a fiery multi-car accident, but, he thinks otherwise. As Jim starts to look into this, he runs into several intimidating figure who want to make certain she stays that way.

guest_stars.character: Dr. Evan Stuart (as Regis J. Cordic)
guest_stars.name: Regis Cordic

episodes.name: Charlie Harris at Large
episodes.overview: Charlie Harris, Rockford's former cell mate, is suspected of murdering his rich wife and is on the run. He calls on Rockford to find his alibi witness, a mystery woman with whom he was having an affair.

episodes.name: The Four Pound Brick
episodes.overview: A cop dies in an accident that his mother refuses to accept. Rocky offers Jim's services free of charge. After begrudgingly accepting the case he discovers that dirty cops might be involved which then pits him against a very angry Lt. Diel.

episodes.name: Just by Accident
episodes.overview: A race car driver dies in an apparent accident that his mother, an old friend of Jim's, thinks was no accident. It turns out he was part of an insurance scam outfit and they soon have a similar plan for Rockford.

episodes.name: Roundabout
episodes.overview: An insurance company hires Rockford to locate a missing woman who is due an inheritance. He finds her in Las Vegas where she is an unwitting pawn in a money laundering operation.

episodes.name: The Aaron Ironwood School of Success
episodes.overview: Aaron Ironwood, a childhood friend of Jim's, comes to town with a business deal that is just too good to be true. He finally agrees to the deal as he thinks Aaron might be in some kind of trouble. He's is - with both the FBI and the mob.

episodes.name: The Farnsworth Stratagem
episodes.overview: Dennis pleads with Jim to untangle him from a timeshare con, without Dennis' boss, Jim's nemesis Lt. Diehl, finding out he's a victim too. Rockford's a lot more interested when a friend of Dennis' who's also an unhappy vacation homeowner, proves very helpful, and happens to be a gorgeous single blonde. Jim recruits his father and Angel to out-scam the scammers.

episodes.name: Gearjammers, Part 1
episodes.overview: Rocky is targeted for death after seeing a meeting between a truck dispatcher and a crooked executive. Jim wants desperately to protect his father but discovers he hasn't been keeping up with Rocky enough to even find him on a typical day. The dispatcher was giving the supposedly-retired Rocky work as a trucker, so when Jim discovers the dispatcher dead in a crate bound for Malaysia, the police figure the elusive Rocky knows why.

episodes.name: Gearjammers, Part 2
episodes.overview: The Rockfords work with Sgt. Becker to solve Rocky's friend's murder. When 6 tractor trailers from the same depot are hijacked by a gang, there must be a connection with the killing, but who desperately needs tons of ladies' underwear, grapefruit and dynamite ? The proud Rocky resents Jim taking care of him, making the slew of hit-men even harder to combat for Dennis and a very confused LAPD.

episodes.name: The Deep Blue Sleep
episodes.overview: After a late night phone call Beth hires Jim to look for a missing friend who eventually turns up dead. The dead woman worked for a fashion designer who is unknowingly in up to her neck with some very bad "fellas".

episodes.name: The Great Blue Lake Land and Development Company
episodes.overview: When his car breaks down in a small town Jim leaves $10,000 in a land company's safe. The next morning the money - and the man who locked the money up - are gone. When the man turns up dead the sheriff thinks Rockford did it.

episodes.name: The Real Easy Red Dog
episodes.overview: Christine Dusseau, a female private eye, first blindsides Rockford, then joins him in tracking down the murderer in a case the police have dismissed as a suicide.

episodes.name: Resurrection in Black & White
episodes.overview: Convinced a convicted murderer is actually innocent, a journalist looking for a scoop hires Jim to investigate a six year old murder.

episodes.name: Chicken Little Is a Little Chicken
episodes.overview: Angel asks Jim to help him collect some money from someone who supposedly welshed on a deal. Not surprisingly he hasn't told Jim the whole truth, which includes two very angry hoods who want money Angel owes them.

episodes.name: 2 Into 5.56 Won't Go
episodes.overview: When an army colonel is murdered after contacting Rockford, Rockford is forced into the middle of a conflict involving military police, military thieves and the colonel's daughter.

episodes.name: Pastoria Prime Pick
episodes.overview: A farming hub has more business than it can handle, including giving Rockford the business. The PI's car breaks down near the boomtown, after a source Rockford contacts in a divorce case steers Rockford there. While his car is being worked on, Rockford is quickly entangled between an underage motel worker and her jealous cop boyfriend, and in a double-cross over a narcotics deal. Is it just another tricky day for unlucky Jim, or is bucolic New Pastoria a sunny sin city ?

episodes.name: The Reincarnation of Angie
episodes.overview: Hoods snatch a stockbroker, and his sister hires Rockford for $23.64, because Jim's in the yellow pages and her big brother instructed her not to dial the cops. Jim's protective of the naive 25 year old bookkeeper, despite the tiny fee, because he fears her brother is dead, and she can't accept that her only relative, who's always taken care of her, may be mixed up in a securities scam.

episodes.name: The Girl in the Bay City Boys Club
episodes.overview: Jim goes undercover to expose an illegal gambling club and gets help from a young D.A.

guest_stars.character: Kate Flanders / Dep. DA Kate Doyle
guest_stars.name: Blair Brown

guest_stars.character: Dep. DA Burton Kimball / Mr. Phelps
guest_stars.name: Stewart Moss

episodes.name: The Hammer of C Block
episodes.overview: A friend (Isaac Hayes) from Jim's time in prison after getting out, needs help clearing himself from the crime he was put into prison for.

episodes.name: The No-Cut Contract
episodes.overview: A minor league football player drags Jim into his troubles.

episodes.name: A Portrait of Elizabeth
episodes.overview: A client of Beth's hires Jim misleadingly to check on his company.

episodes.name: Joey Blue Eyes
episodes.overview: Jim helps one of Beth's clients, who is being swindled out of his business.

episodes.name: In Hazard
episodes.overview: Beth has trouble and is nearly killed by a client with tax trouble.

episodes.name: The Italian Bird Fiasco
episodes.overview: Jim gets hired by a diamond smuggler posing as an art dealer causing trouble for Jim with LAPD and other smugglers.

episodes.name: Where's Houston?
episodes.overview: Rocky's friend is killed thinking his Granddaughter was kidnapped leading Jim with the help of Rocky to untangle a crooked real estate deal.

episodes.name: Foul on the First Play
episodes.overview: Jim's shackled to his ex-parole officer Marcus Aurelius (Louis Gossett Jr.), now a PI himself, when a no-holds barred competition for a new NBA franchise ensnares both sleazes. Jim can't figure which jock-sucker, the motor mouth Marc works for, but whoever it is, they keep bringing Jim the pain and costing him way-too-many non-reimbursed expenses. As a PO, slick Marc tried to send Jim back up the river; as a PI, he runs Jim dizzy dodging bullets.

episodes.name: A Bad Deal in the Valley
episodes.overview: Rockford finds himself in the middle of a bad deal indeed when he agrees to help an old girlfriend and ends up with a suitcase full of counterfeit money and under arrest by the F.B.I.

episodes.name: The Fourth Man
episodes.overview: Jim helps a friend who works in the airline industry, who's apparently being pursued by a hit man, and she's no idea why she's being targeted.

episodes.name: The Oracle Wore a Cashmere Suit
episodes.overview: Rockford finds himself getting unwanted attention from the media and police, when a popular psychic fingers him as having important information on the disappearance of two people.

episodes.name: The Family Hour
episodes.overview: Jim and Rocky find an abandoned young girl that leads to Jim finding and helping her father.

episodes.name: Feeding Frenzy
episodes.overview: Jim helps a friend who wants to pay back money he stole three years earlier when his daughter then gets kidnapped leading to problems for Jim with the kidnappers and the police.

episodes.name: Drought at Indianhead River
episodes.overview: Jim finds out there's a hit out on Angel and runs into trouble with the mob bailing him out.

episodes.name: Coulter City Wildcat
episodes.overview: Rocky is forced to sign oil lease rights he owns away, leading Jim to investigate who and why someone wanted Rocky's seemingly worthless leases so badly.

episodes.name: So Help Me God
episodes.overview: Jim gets called before a grand jury where he promptly gets thrown into jail for contempt.

episodes.name: Rattlers' Class of '63
episodes.overview: Angel is working a con involving the sale of a landfill, and unknown to him or Jim, it happens to be the location of a dead body from an unsolved case from twelve years before. The people who put it there don't want it found.

episodes.name: Return to the 38th Parallel
episodes.overview: Jim gets used by an old Army buddy in an insurance recovery case.

episodes.name: Piece Work
episodes.overview: While investigating an insurance claim Jim accidentally stumbles into a gun smuggling operation.

episodes.name: The Trouble with Warren
episodes.overview: Beth's nerdy cousin Warren drags Jim into his mounting troubles.

episodes.name: There's One in Every Port
episodes.overview: After being conned by friends Jim sets them up to settle the score and save himself.

episodes.name: Sticks and Stones May Break Your Bones, But Waterbury Will Bury You
episodes.overview: When several of Jim's fellow P.I.'s lose their licenses under circumstances that are suspiciously similar, he begins to suspect that someone is targeting independent investigators and systematically putting them out of business.

episodes.name: The Trees, the Bees and T.T. Flowers: Part 1
episodes.overview: Jim helps a friend (Strother Martin) of Rocky's who's being forced off his property.

episodes.name: The Trees, the Bees and T.T. Flowers: Part 2
episodes.overview: Jim helps a friend of Rocky's who's being forced off his property.

episodes.name: The Becker Connection
episodes.overview: Rockford's newest case is to clear his friend Dennis Becker, who is suspected of selling drugs to deal with his financial problems.

episodes.name: Just Another Polish Wedding
episodes.overview: Jim gets Gandy (Isaac Hayes) a job with his P.I. buddy Marcus Hayes (Louis Gossett Jr.) who promptly then tries to steal the case.

episodes.name: New Life, Old Dragons
episodes.overview: Jim is hired by a Vietnamese refugee to find her missing brother.

episodes.name: To Protect and Serve: Part 1
episodes.overview: Rockford is hired to find a missing woman, only to discover that she is also being sought by a New York crime family.

episodes.name: To Protect and Serve: Part 2
episodes.overview: Rockford tries to keep a woman on the run out of the hands of two Minette hoods (and her revenge minded ex-fiancé) but the bungling interference of a disturbed police groupie threatens to get them both killed.

episodes.name: Crack Back
episodes.overview: Beth turns to Jim for help when she finds herself being mentally harassed by a mysterious man while trying to win an important trial.

episodes.name: Dirty Money, Black Light
episodes.overview: Jim becomes very concerned when Rocky starts receiving thousands of dollars through the mail.

episodes.name: Beamer's Last Case
episodes.overview: Rockford returns from vacation in Puerto Rico to discover someone has been using his identity, his trailer and totaled his Firebird. And that's just the beginning of his problems...

episodes.name: Trouble in Chapter 17
episodes.overview: Jim is reluctantly drawn into being bodyguard for a famous author, who believes her popular book on the perfect wife is the cause of death threats against her.

episodes.name: The Battle of Canoga Park
episodes.overview: Jim finds himself in an explosive situation when the gun he hides in his cookie jar is used in a murder.

episodes.name: Second Chance
episodes.overview: When the life of Gandy Fitch's (Isaac Hayes) girlfriend is in danger, he turns to Rockfish for help.

episodes.name: The Dog and Pony Show
episodes.overview: Helping a young woman with a history of mental illness leads Jim into crossing paths with the Mob and federal intelligence.

episodes.name: Requiem for a Funny Box
episodes.overview: A washed-up comedian finds out about a Mob family member's secret, and gets Jim in trouble by framing him for a murder.

episodes.name: Quickie Nirvana
episodes.overview: Rockford ends up regretting allowing an eccentric hippie woman to use his address temporarily, when her ex-boss sends a pair of thugs after her to retrieve some money he put in her care.

guest_stars.character: Jane Patten / Sky Aquarian / Gopi / Hester
guest_stars.name: Valerie Curtin

episodes.name: Irving the Explainer
episodes.overview: Rockford gives himself a headache trying to solve the connection between a 30 year old murder, a valuable missing painting and Nazi Germany.

episodes.name: The Mayor's Committee from Deer Lick Falls
episodes.overview: Jim is hired by some small-town businessmen to help them buy a fire engine; they really want him to assassinate someone who could bring the IRS down on them.

episodes.name: Hotel of Fear
episodes.overview: Accidently witnessing a murder makes Angel Martin the police's prime witness in the trial of the murderer.

episodes.name: Forced Retirement
episodes.overview: Beth's old college friend is in trouble when her company that is developing an submersible robot explorer becomes the target of some shady businessmen. Jimmy Joe Meeker comes to her rescue.

episodes.name: The Queen of Peru
episodes.overview: The RV family from hell decides to set up camp next door to Jim's trailer, just when he's got the recovery of a stolen diamond on his mind.

episodes.name: A Deadly Maze
episodes.overview: Jim is unwittingly involved in a bizarre experiment when hired to find a man's missing wife.

episodes.name: The Attractive Nuisance
episodes.overview: An unexplained break-in at Rocky's new diner has connections with the FBI fifty years ago.

episodes.name: The Gang at Don's Drive-In
episodes.overview: An author suffering from writers block tells Jim he thinks he has the next best seller in an old murder case from 1961.

episodes.name: The Paper Palace
episodes.overview: A prostitute (Rita Moreno) hires Jim to find out who has been sending her death threats.

episodes.name: Dwarf in a Helium Hat
episodes.overview: A threat to the wrong phone number has Jim scrambling to find out who it was meant for.

episodes.name: South by Southeast
episodes.overview: Mistaken identity by federal agents has Jim being sent to South America to help them contact a heiress, who has been isolated by her possessive husband.

episodes.name: The Competitive Edge
episodes.overview: Jim winds up in a funny farm when he gets too close to the truth about an elite health club.

episodes.name: The Prisoner of Rosemont Hall
episodes.overview: When the son of an old friend goes missing, Jim goes to the young man's college to try and find out what happened.

episodes.name: The House on Willis Avenue
episodes.overview: When a fellow P.I. is killed on the Ventura freeway, Jim and Richie Brockelman team up to find out if it really was an accident.

episodes.name: The House on Willis Avenue
episodes.overview: Part two of episode.  Originally aired as 1 2-hour episode.

episodes.name: Heartaches of a Fool
episodes.overview: Jim finds that a country music star, corrupt union boss and Chinese triad all have one thing in common with why Rocky ended in hospital after his rig was forced off the road: sausages.

episodes.name: Rosendahl and Gilda Stern Are Dead
episodes.overview: A doctor's murder has direct connections to the Mob, and Jim comes to the assistance of hooker friend Rita Capcovik (Rita Moreno) when she finds herself entangled in it.

episodes.name: The Jersey Bounce
episodes.overview: Wrongly accused of beating a man to death, Jim discovers the best legal advice he can find is from disbarred lawyer John Cooper.

episodes.name: White on White and Nearly Perfect
episodes.overview: Handsome, charmed PI Lance White (Tom Selleck) may speak lines that sound like they're from a 1940s B movie, but everyone is so attracted to him they hang on his every word. That is, everyone except Jim.

episodes.name: Kill the Messenger
episodes.overview: When an already overly stressed Dennis Becker is lumped with the unwelcome task of finding out who murdered Deputy Chief Towne's unfaithful wife, Jim decides to lend a hand in the investigation.

guest_stars.character: Deputy Police Chief Eugene W. Towne
guest_stars.name: Byron Morrow

episodes.name: The Empty Frame
episodes.overview: At a swank party, attended by some of LA's high society and police dept. VIPs, in honor of Angel's brother-in-law, Aaron, being made Chief of Police, a robbery takes place, while Lt. Doug Chapman is in charge of security. Desperate to get back into good graces with his superiors, Chapman swallows his pride and asks Rockford to help him.

episodes.name: Three Day Affair with a Thirty Day Escrow
episodes.overview: After being strong-armed by an Arab sheik and his goons, and getting no help from the police, Jim decides to track down the two people who caused his trouble: a soft-voiced gigolo and the sheik's naive daughter.

episodes.name: A Good Clean Bust with Sequel Rights
episodes.overview: Jim is forced to babysit Chicago ex-cop, now celebrity, "Frank Falcone," who has a television show and toy line. Falcone isn't easy to babysit, and things get dicey when some old Chicago "friends" of Falcone show up to complicate things.

episodes.name: Black Mirror: Part 1
episodes.overview: A blind psychologist, who is being terrorized by an unknown stalker, turns to Jim for help.

episodes.name: Black Mirror: Part 2
episodes.overview: Rockford's investigation of psychologist Megan Dougherty's stalker leads him to one of her patients who may have a split personality - one of which is a paid killer.

episodes.name: A Fast Count
episodes.overview: Jim puts up his dukes and steps forward to help a boxing coach who has been framed with bribery and murder.

episodes.name: Local Man Eaten by Newspaper
episodes.overview: Jim could use some saintly guidance when he goes undercover on a scandal rag that is getting confidential medical information on a doctor's famous, and infamous, patients.

episodes.name: With the French Heel Back, Can the Nehru Jacket Be Far Behind?
episodes.overview: A fashion model friend of Jim is found dead on the ground below her balcony. The police believe it's suicide, but having gotten a desperate phone call from her, Jim believes it's murder.

episodes.name: The Battle-Ax and the Exploding Cigar
episodes.overview: Ignorant that he's been driving a hot Cadillac with an illegal stash of guns in the trunk, leads Jim into rubbing shoulders with the FBI and the Company.

episodes.name: Guilt
episodes.overview: Jim finds his guilty conscience being manipulated by a former fiancee, who asks him to find out who is threatening her life.

episodes.name: The Deuce
episodes.overview: Having Jim doing jury duty leads to a mistrial and his being hired to investigate the case of pedestrian hit by a drunk-driver that brought the accused to court.

episodes.name: The Man Who Saw the Alligators
episodes.overview: If having the IRS wanting to do an audit isn't bad enough, a gangster Jim helped put in prison is out on parole and wants a pound of his flesh in revenge.

episodes.name: The Return of the Black Shadow
episodes.overview: A gang of bikers beat up Jim and assault John Cooper's sister, leading Coop to seek vengeance by returning to a darker period in his past when he was in a biker gang.

episodes.name: A Material Difference
episodes.overview: Jim finds himself being dragged into a complicated situation when Angel's con job as a hit man for hire goes awry.

episodes.name: Never Send a Boy King to Do a Man's Job: Part 1
episodes.overview: Richie's father has been swindled by a man named Coombs. Jim assembles together a disparate group of con-artists in a complicated scheme using Coombs' anxieties, and even the "Curse" of King Tut, to save Mr. Brockelman from ruin.

episodes.name: Never Send a Boy King to Do a Man's Job: Part 2
episodes.overview: Conclusion

episodes.name: A Different Drummer
episodes.overview: While in hospital after a car accident, Jim stumbles across a black market for vital organs.

episodes.name: Paradise Cove
episodes.overview: Jim's Malibu neighborhood becomes the site of a treasure hunt for a stash of gold bullion, stolen fifty years earlier.

episodes.name: Lions, Tigers, Monkeys and Dogs (1)
episodes.overview: Jim rubs shoulders with royalty when a princess hires him because she believes someone is trying to kill her friend (Lauren Bacall).

episodes.name: Only Rock 'n Roll Will Never Die (1)
episodes.overview: Jim senses something is out of tune while looking into the disappearance of a rock star's producer.

episodes.name: Only Rock 'n Roll Will Never Die (2)
episodes.overview: While consoling his morose love-lorn friend Eddie, Jim continues to look for the missing producer. He eventually finds his body but the presumed killer is not whom he had expected.

episodes.name: Love Is the Word
episodes.overview: Jim reconnects with Dr. Megan Dougherty and discovers she is engaged to another man. When she believes he is missing Jim agrees to help her, despite the fact he disapproves of her engagement and for his feelings for Megan.

guest_stars.character: Barbara Mandrell (as Barbara Mandrell and the 'Do-Rites')
guest_stars.name: Barbara Mandrell

episodes.name: Nice Guys Finish Dead
episodes.overview: The special guest of a P.I. convention dinner is found murdered in the restroom, and Jim unhappily finds himself once more having to team up with flawless Lance White (Tom Selleck), while accident prone Freddie Beamer tags along.

episodes.name: The Hawaiian Headache
episodes.overview: Jim is tricked into believing he's won a trip to Hawaii, when it really turns out to be doing a favor for an old army pal in the CIA.

episodes.name: No Fault Affair
episodes.overview: Rita Capkovic (Rita Moreno) comes to Jim for help after her former pimp has beaten her up for refusing to work for him again. As Jim helps Rita recover she begins to see him as more than just as a friend, to the concern of everyone.

episodes.name: The Big Cheese
episodes.overview: Rockford gets a phone call telling him to expect a package in the mail. Two hoods then murder the caller and go to Rockford's trailer to await the package's arrival. When the package is a wheel of cheese the mystery only gets deeper.

episodes.name: Just a Coupla Guys
episodes.overview: Rockford flies to Newark for a case and is robbed, leaving him stranded at the police station. Jim is caught in the middle of a mob war when 2 mooks, looking to make a name for themselves, get involved and complicate everything.

episodes.name: Deadlock in Parma
episodes.overview: In the series finale, Jim Rockford drives off into a California sunset in his wounded Firebird, after being ensnared in a small-town council battle with big implications. While trout fishing in the mountains, the vacationing PI becomes the emergency proxy for a fellow angler, an environmentalist councilman, felled by appendicitis. But the seemingly-innocuous proposition for a Parma city park, attracts a trailer load of New Jersey mobsters who urge Rockford to keep his vote green, or sleep with the fishes. Meanwhile, this town council in the land of endless propositions, acts to force their temporary member Rockford to go fishing under the moonlight, but not in Parma.
